name: cousin
content:
Add to word list

A2 a child of a person's aunt or uncle, or, more generally, a distant (= not close) relation: My brother's wife and I both had babies around the same time, so the cousins are very close in age. Many of our distant cousins, whom we hadn't seen for years, came to my sister's wedding. See also
first cousin
second cousin

a member of a group of people with similar origins: We Americans owe a great deal to our European cousins.
something that is related to or similar to another thing: The cardoon is a close cousin of the artichoke. The work is a contemporary cousin to Mozart's "Magic Flute".
